text:
I cannot compile Apache 2.0.50 on Fedora Core devel with GCC 3.4.1.

Output of gcc --version:
===
gcc (GCC) 3.4.1 20040702 (Red Hat Linux 3.4.1-1)
Copyright (C) 2004 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
This is free software; see the source for copying conditions.  There is NO
warranty; not even for MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.
===

Input for compiling:
===
./configure --enable-mods-shared=all --enable-ssl --enable-proxy --enable-suexec
--with-suexec-caller=nobody --with-suexec-docroot=/home

make
===

Output of compiler:
===
Making all in srclib
make[1]: Entering directory `/root/httpd-2.0.50/srclib'
Making all in apr
make[2]: Entering directory `/root/httpd-2.0.50/srclib/apr'
Making all in strings
make[3]: Entering directory `/root/httpd-2.0.50/srclib/apr/strings'
make[4]: Entering directory `/root/httpd-2.0.50/srclib/apr/strings'
/bin/sh /root/httpd-2.0.50/srclib/apr/libtool --silent --mode=compile gcc -g -O2
-pthread   -DHAVE_CONFIG_H -DLINUX=2 -D_REENTRANT -D_XOPEN_SOURCE=500
-D_BSD_SOURCE -D_SVID_SOURCE -D_GNU_SOURCE   -I../include -I../include/arch/unix
 -c apr_cpystrn.c && touch apr_cpystrn.lo
make[4]: *** [apr_cpystrn.lo] Error 1
make[4]: Leaving directory `/root/httpd-2.0.50/srclib/apr/strings'
make[3]: *** [all-recursive] Error 1
make[3]: Leaving directory `/root/httpd-2.0.50/srclib/apr/strings'
make[2]: *** [all-recursive] Error 1
make[2]: Leaving directory `/root/httpd-2.0.50/srclib/apr'
make[1]: *** [all-recursive] Error 1
make[1]: Leaving directory `/root/httpd-2.0.50/srclib'
make: *** [all-recursive] Error 1
===

Kernel version is 2.6.7-1.471.
creator: floeff@arcor.de

text:
The gcc-3.4.1-1 package is known to have issues, this is likely to be a compiler
problem.
creator: jorton@redhat.com
floeff@arcor.de
text:
Is there anything to make sure this is a compiler problem? Any log files or
debug output I could send in?

>Is there anything to make sure this is a compiler problem? 

The compiler exited with bad status yet failed to issue a diagnostic message. 
That doesn't sound like a source code issue to me.

/bin/sh /root/httpd-2.0.50/srclib/apr/libtool --silent --mode=compile gcc -g -O2
-pthread   -DHAVE_CONFIG_H -DLINUX=2 -D_REENTRANT -D_XOPEN_SOURCE=500
-D_BSD_SOURCE -D_SVID_SOURCE -D_GNU_SOURCE   -I../include -I../include/arch/unix
 -c apr_cpystrn.c && touch apr_cpystrn.lo
make[4]: *** [apr_cpystrn.lo] Error 1
creator: trawick@apache.org
